titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Rosanna Bencoach papers, 1932-2014
titlestmt.subtitle: Bencoach, Rosanna, papers, 1932-2014 43964
titlestmt.author: Trenton Hizer

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid derived from MARC record by Trenton Hizer, 22 September 2016

titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Rosanna Bencoach papers, 1932-2014
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 43964

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Rosanna Bencoach papers, 1932-2014

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Rosanna Bencoach papers, 1932-2014. Accession 43964. Personal papers collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Rosanna Bencoach, Richmond, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Papers, 1932-2014, of Rosanna Bencoach of Richmond, Virginia, containing ads, books, booklets, brochures, bumper stickers, cassette tapes, envelopes, fliers, letters, magazines, postcards, programs, reports, rosters, stamps, stereographic cards, VHS tapes, DVDs, and other papers mainly concerning Virginia politics from the 1970s through the 2010s, including state and national campaigns, the Virginia Republican Party, the Virginia legislature, and various political organizations. Collection also includes materials on the Reynolds Metals Company, Native Americans, national parks, University of Virginia basketball, the Washington Redskins, the Waltons television show, postcards, and audio and video recordings regarding politics and history.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

did.unittitle: Series I: Political papers, 1960-2014.

scopecontent.p: Political papers, 1960-2014, contain ads, articles, brochures, fliers, newsletters, photographs, reports, and other papers, as well as audio and video recordings concerning elections for president, governor, Congress, General Assembly, and other offices. Papers include materials for the Virginia Republican party and for institutes connected with the University of Virginia. Papers also contain records regarding political activites of elected officials.

Series II: General papers, 1932-ca. 2007.

scopecontent.p: General papers, 1932-ca. 2007, consisting of booklets, brochures, bumper stickers, envelopes, fliers, magazines, postcards, programs, rosters, stamps, stereographic cards and VHS tapes and DVDs concerning George Washington, Henrico County, Virginia, historical sites, national parks (Shenandoah and Great Smoky Mountains), Native Americans in Virginia and North Carolina, Philip Mazzei, the Washington Redskins, Reynolds Metals Company, the University of Virginia basketball team, and the Waltons television show.
